intro: Crepis fraasii subsp. mungieri, commonly known as the Mungieri's mouse-ear, is a small, herbaceous plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, basal rosette of leaves and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowering period occurs in the summer months, and it is often found in alpine or steppe regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
